Tool Items in Service Transactions: You can now enter tools for the following service transactions in order to bill them to your customers and to determine and allocate internal costs: Service orders, service order templates, and service quotations (item categories: SRVT, SRTT, SRQT) Service confirmations (item category SVCT).
      9. Editable Fields in Output Control: You can now edit fields under Output Control in service orders, service quotations, service contracts, and solution quotations. Previously, these fields were read-only. This feature allows you to customize output settings for service transactions to meet specific needs, for example, to edit the output queue.
      10. Profit Center Reorganization in Service: This feature supports profit center reorganization in service transactions to align with organizational changes that take place in your company. During the reorganization process, profit centers and/or segments are reassigned and their stocks or balances are reposted to the new organizational entities.
      11. Plant and Storage Location in Service Transactions: The plant and storage location can now be automatically determined and displayed when the service transaction item is entered. You can also manually change the plant and storage location in the Items assignment block. If you manually change the plant and then want to change it back to the original value, you can use the Redetermine Plant/Location button in the Items assignment block.

Sourcing and Procurement

  • Central Procurement

    • Central Purchase Contract Processing
      1. Custom Split Criteria for Central Purchase Contracts: This feature allows you to customize how the Central Purchase Contracts are split and distributed to connected systems based on plant, storage location, and custom fields.
    • Central Purchasing
      1. Addition of New Fields in Purchase Order Extraction: This feature enables you to extract the Shipping Instruction and Price Printout fields from Purchase Orders (PO), both taken from the item-level fields in the PO data.

  • Operational Procurement

    • Purchase Order Processing
      1. Aggregation of Lean Service - Related Purchase Order History Items: This feature enables you to include lean service standard items as well as enhanced limit items in transaction ME87(Summarization and Removal of PO History Records).

  • General

    1. Allow Posting of Non-Valuated Good Receipts to Service Entry Sheets: This feature enables you to allow posting of non-valuated good receipts to Service Entry Sheets (SES).
    2. Service Master Data Migration Report to SAP S/4HANA: This feature enables you to transition from using MM-SRV in SAP S/4HANAto the Lean Service Product model. By running the RMMSRV_SRVMSTR_MIG_TO_S4 report, it converts your existing Service Master Data into the Lean Service Product format. This ensures your data aligns with the structural requirements of the SAP S/4HANA system, making the migration process smooth for our existing customers.
    3. Migration of Service Purchase Orders to Lean Services in SAP S/4HANA: This feature enables you to close existing service-based purchase order (PO) data from legacy tables and create new ones in the Lean format. Lean Services is SAP’s strategic solution for Service Procurement moving forward. While MM-SRV remains available, it will no longer receive functional enhancements.
    4. Migration of Service-Based Purchasing Contracts to Lean Contracts: This feature enables you to migrate service-based purchasing contracts from MM-SRV to Lean Contracts in the SAP S/4HANA system, based on user-defined input. It allows users to choose whether the migrated contracts should be created as hierarchical structures or as flat item lists.
    5. Mapping MM-SRV Document Types to Lean Services: This feature enables you to define a mapping between classic MM-SRV document types and their corresponding Lean Service document types in SAP S/4HANA .
    6. WBS Element Available in Service Entry Sheet Upload Template: This feature enables you to input the WBS Element directly in the Service Entry Sheet (SES) upload template instead of the internal WBS Element ID number.
    7. New Fields for Service Entry Sheet (Lean Services) API: This feature enables you to use the two new service-related fields Budget Period and Grant ID in the Service Entry Sheet (Lean Services) API.
    8. Non-Valuated Goods Receipt Supported in Purchase Requisitions: This feature enables you to define in the purchase requisition (PR) whether the goods receipt (GR) for a service should be non-valuated. The setting is transferred to the purchase order (PO) and determines how the GR is handled when posting the Service Entry Sheet (SES).

Supply Chain

  • Advanced Order Promising

    • Advanced Available to Promise
      1. ATP Categories in Availability Change Log: With this feature, the Availability Change Log (ACL) framework now records the ATP category along with the material, plant, MRP area, date, and time details for selected documents.
      2. Pool Segment as Planning Level in Supply Protection: This feature enables you to use pool segments as an additional planning level in supply protection. This allows the setup of supply protection, for example, for a specific quality grade. In such a case, supply protection could be set up in such a way that the articles with the highest quality are reserved for special protection groups such as key customers, whereas there isn't any restriction in place for lower-quality articles.
      3. Maximum Sequence Number in Alternative Determination: With this feature, you can use a new rating attribute to determine alternative confirmations for a requirement.
      4. With Creation of Stock Transport Document: With this feature, you can simplify logistical processes by triggering the automatic creation of transport orders to move stock from substitute plants or storage locations to the plant or storage location originally requested in an order.
      5. Rounding Confirmations in Sales Documents: With this feature, you can use rounding for confirmed quantities in sales orders and stock transport orders.
      6. Ability to Override Existing Confirmation Constraints: With this feature, users can override any existing Product Availability Check (PAC), Product Allocation (PAL) or Supply Protection (SUP) constraints to allocate confirmation to a requirement.
      7. Optimistic Reservation of Quantity: With this feature, you can configure the type of quantity reservation that is to be applied when the availability for a requested product is checked.
      8. Calculation of Supply and Demand for Subcontracting: With this feature, you can now configure how supply and demand is considered for product availability checks involving subcontracting scenarios.
      9. Batch as Planning Level in Supply Protection: This feature enables you to use batches as an additional planning level in supply protection. This allows for the protection of a specific batch of a vaccine. Batch identification can also be relevant for paints, chemicals, cosmetics, food, etc. In such a case, supply protection can be set up in a way that the quantities of a specific batch are reserved for special protection groups, while there isn't any restriction in place for other batches.
      10. Overprotection Alert in Supply Protection: Use this new standard template (CA_ATP_SUP_OVERPROTECTION) if you want your order fulfillment managers to be informed when the restrictions defined in Supply Protection lead to a critical availability situation when protected quantities are too high. Recipients can get notifications whenever the availability situation in combination with Supply Protection leads to a complete lock, or if single supply protection objects or single protection groups of related supply protection objects are locked.
      11. First Come First Served (FCFS) in Backorder Processing (BOP): With this feature, the system ensures that the availability check gives priority to earlier sales documents and stock transport orders even when later orders are altered.

  • Delivery and Transportation

    • Transportation Management
      1. Ocean Freight Tendering: With this feature, you, as a shipper, can use the direct tendering (non-RFQ) process to send a tendering plan or ocean freight booking directly to the carriers.
      2. Key Performance Indicators in the Transportation Cockpit: With this feature, you can display and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) in the transportation cockpit.
      3. Calculation of Distances Traveled with or Without Load: This feature enables you to have visibility regarding distances that are traveled either with or without load and whether the corresponding transportation stages are empty or not. Based on this information, you are able to measure the efficiency of your fleet by calculating the ratio of the distance traveled with load and the total distance, for example.
      4. New Handling Execution Status: Cargo Ready for Loading: With this feature, you can use the handling execution status Cargo Ready for Loading, which, when so customized, starts the creation of customs invoice and export declaration before the goods are loaded onto a truck in an Advanced Shipping and Receiving process.

  • Inventory

    • Extended Service Parts Planning
      1. Assign Location Product-Specific Segmentations (Clusters): With this feature, you can assign location product-specific segmentations (clusters) to parts in the product master data within SAP S/4HANA and use them in the Extended Service Parts Planning processes. Clusters serve to group location products of the same kind. You define a cluster type for the criterion with which the clusters are to be formed.
      2. Consideration of Lead Time Variability in Multistage Safety Stock Calculation: This feature enables you to consider lead time variability measures when running the Multistage Safety Stock PSM service.
      3. Forecast Adjustment: This feature enables you to modify forecast results using a factor or a specific value. If you anticipate an increase or decrease in demand, you can adjust the forecast.
      4. OEM-Managed Inventory: With this feature, you can plan the stock of selected dealers. In this way, you can support these dealers in optimizing their procurement planning and stock situation. Furthermore, these dealers no longer need to order from you actively; as the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) and owner of Extended Service Parts Planning (eSPP), you trigger the transfer of stock to a dealer location for normal replenishment.
      5. Stock Monitoring Demand vs. Stock: This feature enables you to proactively manage inventory by providing timely notifications when stock levels fall below a critical threshold compared to the recent demand history quantity. This is particularly important for industries where maintaining the availability of specialized parts is a significant challenge.
      6. Stock Monitoring Phase-Out Forecast vs. Stock: This feature enables you to effectively manage the availability of End of Production (EOP) parts, supporting compliance with business and legal requirements for Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs). It addresses the challenges faced when suppliers discontinue the supply of EOP parts.

  • Warehousing

    • Warehouse Management
      1. Handling Execution Status: Cargo Ready for Loading: With this feature, you can set the handling execution status of a freight order to Cargo Ready for Loading or Cargo Not Ready for Loading in the Load or Unload Freight Orders app. You can use this feature if you want to conduct customs processes before a truck arrives at your warehouse.
      2. Reverse Goods Receipt after Final Put away for Stock from External Procurement: With this feature, you can also reverse goods receipt for stock from external procurement after final put away.
      3. Batch-Specific Units of Measure in Decentralized EWM: This feature enables you to work with batch-specific units of measure in decentralized Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) based on SAP S/4HANA during inbound, outbound, and internal warehouse processes, for example, physical inventory, warehouse-internal movements, or change posting.

Utilities

  1. New Time-Dependent Attributes for the Point of Delivery: In certain markets, for example in Germany, a point of delivery (referred to as the market location in Germany) can be changed to a “dormant” status. Besides this new status, additional attributes must be also added as time-dependent to the point of delivery.
  2. Setup Date Fields of Utilities Contract: Customizing settings for automatic setup of date fields in Utilities contracts allows users to efficiently manage contract durations, renewal dates, and other scheduling data. This feature is essential for ensuring accurate and streamlined contract management processes with Utilities sales contracts.

FIN (Finance) FIN Controlling SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Service SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Sourcing and Procurement SAP S/4HANA for advanced ATP SAP S/4HANA SAP S/4HANA Finance

entry.title: Join the Data and Analytics Value Map on SAP Community
entry.content:
SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps have moved to SAP Community. Join us now in the SAP Community Groups to stay up to date and informed on the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio for Data and Analytics, ranging from Expert-guided implementation (EGI) sessions, Continuous Quality Check (CQC) services, E-learnings, SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council pilot programs and more.

The Data and Analytics Value Map provides guidance for solutions including SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP Databricks, as well as SAP BusinessObjects. To see our new look in the SAP Community, watch the short SAP video (1 min, 30): SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps on SAP Community

 

How to Access

  • To access the SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps Group, you must login to SAP Community with an S-user ID or a Universal ID
  • Navigate to us via the tab “Groups”, then “Customer Only Groups” or via our dedicated page: SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps

  • Once in the SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps Group, select the Data and Analytics Value Map and click “Join Group”
  • Expand the “Options” button and click “Subscribe” to get email notifications of activity within the group
  • Why join and subscribe? To set customization preferences, get notifications, participate in the group and have a better user experience

 

Blog Posts

We will continue to post blogs to let you know about availability of new and updated content in the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio, such as new E-Learnings, events taking place, best practices, and other relevant information for the Data and Analytics topic.

 

Knowledge Base

Our Knowledge Base is a collection of documents, which provide both foundational information and in-depth guidance for SAP Data and Analytics topics including SAP Business Data Cloud. These focused documents organize the Expert-guided implementation (EGI) sessions, Continuous Quality Check (CQC) services, E-learnings, best practices, and more by topic. Making it easier for you to see in one place the SAP Enterprise Support offerings by topic and/or solution area. Here are three Knowledge Base directories to bookmark within the Data and Analytics Value Map:   

  • SAP Business Data Cloud Directory
  • SAP Data Warehousing Directory
  • SAP BusinessObjects BI 2025 Directory

 

Q&A

Use the Q&A section to ask us questions or find questions that have already been answered. For example, maybe you need guidance on how to find best practices and make use of the SAP Enterprise Support offerings for your project such as a BW modernization in SAP Business Data Cloud. The following could be relevant for you: 

  • EGI for SAP BW Modernization with SAP Business Data Cloud
  • CQC for Private Cloud Go-Live 
  • CQC for Implementation
  • CQC Technical Performance Optimization (TPO)
  • CQC Business Process Performance Optimization (BPPO)
  • CQC for Security Optimization
  • CQC for Data Volume Management

Full details are in the Knowledge Base SAP BW Modernization with Foundational Support

 

Events

The monthly EGI schedule will be populated here giving details of the planned EGI topics, dates, time, regions and languages.

 

Request a Call

Request a call with one of our topic experts to connect with the right content and resources.

 

LIVE SESSIONS on SAP Enterprise Support value maps – Our Move to SAP Community

Join this live session on October 22, 2025, to learn more, where we will demo SAP Enterprise Support value maps on SAP Community. 🔗 Link to join / Watch Replay

 
Enhance Your SAP Experience with Value Maps 

SAP Enterprise Support offers additional resources to help you drive innovation. SAP Enterprise Support value maps provide expert-led resources, tailored recommendations, and advisory services - all included in your SAP cloud subscription. Get started today:

  • One-time sign up for SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, using a valid S-User ID (please allow up to 2 hours for processing)
  • Access SAP Enterprise Support value maps for personalized guidance
  • Request a call with our solution area experts for tailored advice

Value Maps are part of SAP Enterprise Support commitment to your success. Visit the SAP Enterprise Support value maps landing page to explore our range of topics and start engaging with us today.

 

About the author: 
Caroline Sheridan is a Topic Expert for SAP Enterprise Support value maps, specializing in SAP Data and Analytics. With a tenure of 12 years at SAP, Caroline’s expertise lies in assisting and guiding customers to succeed through SAP Enterprise Support offerings. 

💡Have questions or feedback on this content? Feel free to leave a comment below or submit them in the Q&A section.
